title: How to Remove Bird Dropping Stains from Clothes

steps.headline: Scoop the poop.
steps.description: Using a dull knife or spoon, scoop up any excess residue. Work from the outside in to prevent spreading the stain.

steps.headline: Flush it.
steps.description: Many times, water will be able to get rid of all or most of the stain at hand. In this case, flush the stain with cool water until the stain is gone or nearly gone.

steps.headline: Bleach it.
steps.description: If the stain is still visible, use hydrogen peroxide or some other bleach that is safe on the fabric. Use 3% hydrogen peroxide that is most often used for first aid. Be sure to test a hidden area for colorfastness before treating the stain.

steps.headline: Laugh about it.
steps.description: Now that the stain is out, maybe you can now laugh about it. Apparently, being the recipient of a bird dropping is good luck.

text: Scoop the poop. Using a dull knife or spoon, scoop up any excess residue. Work from the outside in to prevent spreading the stain. Flush it. Many times, water will be able to get rid of all or most of the stain at hand. In this case, flush the stain with cool water until the stain is gone or nearly gone. Bleach it. If the stain is still visible, use hydrogen peroxide or some other bleach that is safe on the fabric. Use 3% hydrogen peroxide that is most often used for first aid. Be sure to test a hidden area for colorfastness before treating the stain. Laugh about it. Now that the stain is out, maybe you can now laugh about it. Apparently, being the recipient of a bird dropping is good luck.
